Description: The forecast for January underestimated the actual value, missing the stronger-than-expected performance. Despite this, the forecast showed a decent attempt to align with early-year trends.
As of February, the actual value remained high, while the forecast again fell short. The consistency in underestimation suggests the model didn’t fully capture the sustained momentum from January.
As of March, actual values increased further, surpassing forecasts once more. While the forecast adjusted upward, it struggled to keep pace with the continued growth in exports.
As of April, the actual value rose again, outpacing the forecast. The model anticipated some growth but underestimated the strength of the upward trend seen since the start of the year.
As of May, actual values climbed to their highest point so far, well above the forecast. The model maintained a steady prediction but didn’t capture the accelerating growth observed this month.
As of June, both actual values and forecasts dipped slightly. The gap between them narrowed, suggesting the model adjusted better to the mid-year shift compared to earlier months.
As of July, actual values surged back up significantly, exceeding the forecast by a notable margin. The forecast predicted some recovery, but the scale of growth was underestimated.

As of August, actual values reached their peak for the year so far, far outpacing the forecast. This highlights the model’s difficulty in capturing unexpected spikes, especially during late-year trends.

As of September, actual values remained strong but slightly decreased from August, while forecasts underestimated the level once again. The model did not account for the lingering strength in exports.
As of October, actual data is unavailable, but the forecast predicts a slight dip compared to September. If the trend from previous months persists, actual values might still exceed the forecast.
As of November, actual data is yet to come. Forecasts suggest moderate changes, but if the trends of strong performance continue, actual values may once again surpass predictions.
As of December, actual data is yet to come. Forecasts suggest moderate changes, but if the trends of strong performance continue, actual values may once again surpass predictions.
